intro: Ruschia ebracteata, commonly known as the Cape primrose, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its compact, succulent growth habit and fleshy, often hairy stems. The plant produces clusters of small, brightly colored flowers, typically in shades of red, orange, or yellow, which bloom in spring and summer. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in a fine layer of white or silver hairs, aiding in water retention. Ruschia ebracteata is well adapted to arid environments and is often used in rock gardens or as a houseplant due to its low water requirements.
